Thanks to @RepHerrell for hosting us! @RepGrothman @RepRalphNorman @RepFredKeller @RepAndyBiggsAZ @RepFranklin @RepLaTurner @RepDonaldsPress http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey4d8zcW8AUkkto.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey4d8zcWQAQzRDt.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey4d8zcWYAYoQ5Z.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey4d8zdXMAg4ErY.jpg

"The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time." 

Happy Birthday to the author of this quote, the Declaration of Independence, and one of the greatest figures in American history, President Thomas Jefferson. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey38qRgWYAk50Dq.jpg

Pres. Biden and VP Harris are doing nothing to stop the flow of illegal migrants crossing the border. We must end these disastrous policies; secure our border through a physical barrier, and patrol agents; and adhere to or modernize our country’s immigration system. 8/8

President Biden’s policies paved the way for this full scale crisis. He promised citizenship – no pathway, just outright citizenship – to more than 11 million illegal immigrants and halted border wall construction. 7/8

The heartbreak doesn’t stop at the Donna facility. Last week, Gov. Abbott called on the federal government to close a facility housing migrant children in San Antonio, due to complaints of abuse, sexual assault, and COVID positive children not able to be isolated. 6/8

After being processed, the children are separated into rooms meant to house 30 people, but instead, there are anywhere from 300 to 600 children at one time. Today, there are over 4,000 people being detained in the Donna facility.
5/8

Texas migrant facilities are over 700% capacity. The children are housed here until they are transferred into a long-term care facility. This transfer legally is supposed to occur 72 hours after being processed, but  children reside there as long as 18 days.
4/8

The daily average of unaccompanied minors crossing the border has nearly doubled since 2019, and there is no end in sight. By the end of the year, a projected 2 million migrants will cross the southern border.
3/8

The children I saw have been traumatized and been taken advantage of by Mexican cartels. These cartels are making hundreds of millions of dollars every day by exploiting children. Under the Biden Administration, cartels are the winners, and innocent children are the losers.
2/8

I visited the southern border and the U.S. Customs and Border Protection Facility in Donna, Texas.

What I saw there was nothing short of a heartbreak.
1/8 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey5CZCoWEAgaG_e.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey5CZClWQAEU9fO.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey5CZCpXEAUMDe5.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey5CZCtW8AU_shy.jpg

When it comes to counterterrorism, America should fight away games not home games.
Not only will a withdrawal put our national security at risk, but the democratically-elected Afghan government will be left to fend against bloodthirsty and battle-tested Taliban forces.

The Taliban haven't lived up to their commitments to break away with Al-Qaeda and have strategically planned for a total U.S. withdrawal in order to take back power. We must stay on offense with a small forward presence working with local Afghan security forces.
And we'll have to fight without our local allies, without bases, and possibly having to deal with the Taliban in charge of the Afghan government.

Biden Admin’s plan to withdraw all U.S. troops from Afghanistan is repeating the mistakes of Pres Obama’s withdrawal from Iraq in 2011.

I'm going to keep speaking out. 

If sharing my story about post-traumatic stress can encourage just one person to pick up the phone & ask for help, that's the goal.

If you need mental health help, text "STRENGTH" to 741-741 to be connected to a certified crisis counselor.

The majority of responses to my story have been positive. But sadly, quite a few were negative (examples below). Personally, I'll be OK––I'm a tough guy from Flint & doing great.

But we need to put an end to this name-calling & unkindness that keeps people from getting help. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey34GVSWEAAaZCJ.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey34GVYXEAU35l7.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey34GVXXAAEDWR7.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ey34GVdWgAACtBu.jpg

To the hundreds of people who've called, texted, tweeted or email their support––thank you. 

I went public about my post-traumatic stress and seeing a therapist because we need to end the stigma around mental health.

Too many people don't seek help. That needs to change.
